variants.Description in input context: This variant was found in a patient with late-onset adrenoleukodystrophy.

Material used.Description: Genomic DNA was extracted from the patient's blood samples.

Readout description.Molecular Effect: Alteration in the amino acid sequence at position 241 of the protein
Readout description.Result Description: The sequencing results showed a change from alanine to glycine at position 241 in the ABCD1 protein.

Biological replicates.Description: Since Sanger sequencing is a single-sample analysis, no biological replicates were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was run multiple times to ensure the accuracy of the results.

Basic positive control.Description: Sanger sequencing does not typically use a positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Sanger sequencing does not typically use a negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Description: Sanger sequencing is a direct DNA sequencing method and does not require statistical analysis.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: No threshold for normal readout as Sanger sequencing identifies the specific sequence of the gene.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Any change in the base pair sequence identified by Sanger sequencing can be considered an abnormal readout.

Approved assay.Description: Sanger sequencing is a well-established method for the detection of mutations in genes.
